_comment: Created by ianb on 29/05/2014 15:03:25 using v2.1
title: How does five-year breast cancer survival in the UK compare to other countries?
analysis_commentary: Five-year relative survival for breast cancer has been steadily improving in the UK over time reaching 82% in 2007-2012. However, despite a relatively high breast cancer screening coverage in the UK (LINK), when compared to several other OECD countries, UK continues to lag behind in survival; United States has reached the highest five-year relative survival levels (89.3% in 2003-2008).
data_source: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development, Health Data
